intro: Perezia lactucoides subsp. palustris, commonly known as the marsh lettuce, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland habitats in Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its rosette growth pattern and small, lobed leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in marshes, fens, and other wetland environments. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
